results.title: Sweet smell of success [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, James Hill and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This film noir has been well described as, ‘a rat trap of a film’, a compelling portrayal of corruption in which an unscrupulous small-time press agent, intent on clawing his way to the top, debases himself for the favours of a monster of a newspaper columnist. While it does not involve murder, the degree of manipulation and self deception is truly noir. Sidney Falco, the agent, is ultimately a more sympathetic figure because the cold bloodedness and self-righteous egomania of the columnist, J.J. Hunsecker, sets Falco’s faint glimmerings of self-disgust into relief. Susan Hunsecker, the object of her brother’s repressed incestuous desire, is the one figure who provides some moral bearings and delivers the retribution that J.J. fears. New York locations, aided by James Wong Howe’s night photography and Bernstein’s limpid jazz score, have never seemed bleaker. Featuring Burt Lancaster, Tony Curtis, Susan Harrison, Screenplay, Clifford Odets and Ernest Lehman from the novelette by Ernest Lehman.

results.title: State and Main
results.creator_credit: David Mamet, Sarah Green, El Dorado Pictures, Green/Renzi, Filmtown Entertainment and Fine Line Features
results.brief_description: Written and directed by David Mamet (The Winslow boy, The Spanish prisoner) “State and Main” is a humorous tale about the making of a big-budget Hollywood film in small town USA. Walt Price is a director in pre-production for his latest flick, “The Old mill” and plagued by problems. Having fled New Hampshire under a cloud, Price and his production team arrive in Waterford, Vermont, assuming that local inhabitants will be a pushover. Among Price’s hurdles are: leading man Bob Barrenger, whose hobby is picking up underage girls; leading actress Claire who has decided not to reveal her breasts for this particular film; writer Joseph Turner White who’s script has to be altered as the old mill has burnt down, making his title (and much of his script) redundant. Some locals take to the interlopers, but others seek to manipulate them to make a buck. Town folk include Ann, an amateur writer who assists White with his screenplay; Carla, a teenager with designs on Barrenger; and George Bailey, the mayor intent on making his town famous. “State and Main” is layered with numerous stories about the creation of a Hollywood film. Starring Phillip Seymour Hoffman, Rebecca Pidgeon, William H. Macy, Sarah Jessica Parker and Julia Stiles.

results.title: A Bug's life [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Lasseter, Kevin Reher, Darla Anderson, Pixar Animation Studios and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A Bug’s Life is a perfect example of how technology can be used to tell a good story. The computer generated animation from this Pixar film is amazing, but what makes it watchable are the gorgeous characters and enthralling story. When Flik endangers the future of the ant colony, Princess Atta sends him away to find help. A gang of grasshoppers- led by the menacing Hopper, will return by the end of the summer to accept the colony’s offering, which will take the colony the whole summer to collect. Flik runs into a group of circus performing insects who he mistakenly thinks are warriors. Will the colourful troupe and Flik be able to save the colony from Hopper’s wrath? Includes the voices of Kevin Spacey, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Phyllis Diller, Denis Leary, Madeline Kahn and Roddy McDowall. The film also includes the Pixar animated short, “The Game”, which won the 1997 Academy Award for Best Animated Short.

results.title: Fantasia [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An animated feast of music and visuals. Featuring a soundtrack of classical music, including selections by Bach, Tchaikovsky and Moussorgsky, the film weds animated narratives to the famous musical pieces. “Fantasia” includes one of Disney’s most loved sequences, “The Sorcerer’s Apprentice”. At its best the film’s animation remains magical and visually breath-taking.

results.title: Nell [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted, Jodie Foster, Rene Missel, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Egg Pictures and PolyGram Filmed Entertainment
results.brief_description: Jodie Foster is mesmerising in her role as Nell, a woman raised in an isolated wilderness. When her mother dies, Nell is forced to face a whole new world of discovery, fear and people who want to strip her of her once protected innocence. Her precarious journey into modern society is carefully monitored by Dr. Jerome Lovell (Liam Neeson) and psychologist, Paula Olson (Natasha Richardson), who are moved by Nell’s special untouched spirit and purity. Cast also includes Richard Libertini, Nick Searcy, Jeremy Davies and O’Neal Compton. Based on the play “Idioglossia” by Mark Handley.

results.title: Training day [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Antoine Fuqua, Bobby Newmyer, Jeffrey Silver, NPV Entertainment, Warner Bros Pictures and Village Roadshow Pictures
results.brief_description: It takes weeks to prove yourself when starting a new job. Unfortunately, rookie policeman Jake Hoyt has one day to prove himself to Detective Sergeant Alonzo Harris, head of the L.A. Police Department narcotic squad. Harris has a reputation for being the best, and Hoyt is eager to impress him on the ride-along. However, Hoyt soon discovers that Detective Sergeant Harris makes his own rules, becoming violent when his street-justice methods are questioned. Battling with his own morals, Hoyt soon realises that there is more to Harris than meets the eye, and soon realises that his first day at work may also be his last. Denzel Washington won the Best Actor in a Leading Role Academy Award in 2002 for his role as the corrupt Detective Sergeant Alonzo Harris, while Ethan Hawke (Jake Hoyt) was nominated for the Best Actor in a Supporting Role. Cast also includes Tom Berenger, Scott Glenn and musicians Snoop Dogg, Dr. Dre and Macy Gray.

results.title: Blood oath = Prisoners of the sun [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallace, Brian A. Williams, Denis Whitburn, Charles Waterstreet and Siege Productions
results.brief_description: The Ambon tribunal which tried 91 Japanese soldiers for war crimes against Australian prisoners during World War II provided the basis for the script co-written by the son of John Williams who was the Australian prosecuting officer (Captain Cooper in the film, played by Bryan Brown). The film attempts to portray the perplexing issue of war guilt, against the background of international power politics, through the rhetoric of courtroom drama. It can usefully be compared with the Japanese documentary “The Tokyo Trial” (1984), the second half of which deals with the trial of 28 alleged war criminals. Cast also includes George Takei, Terry O’Quinn, John Bach, John Polson, Russell Crowe, Toshi Shioya, John Clarke and Deborah Unger. In English and Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Boycott = Baycot [NTSC]
results.brief_description: Mohsen Makhmalbaf received international renown and attention in the 1990s with a series of films, such as “Salaam Cinema”, “Gabbeh” and “A Moment of Innocence”, that placed him in the forefront of stylists and artists working in Iranian post-revolutionary cinema. “Boycott” is an early feature, his fourth, made a few years after the Islamic Revolution transformed Iranian society. Heavily influenced by Costas-Gavras’ early radical films, in particular “Z”, the relentless action, violence and over-wrought acting of “Boycott” will come as a surprise to viewers who only know Makhmalbaf’s later work. However, though it does betray the serious strictures of budget and resources affecting Iranian cinema at the time, “Boycott” is nevertheless an engrossing political thriller about the suffering and disillusionment experienced by Valeh (Mohammad Kasebi), a revolutionary agitator in pre-Revolutionary Tehran. The film starts with Valeh’s comrades brutally killed by the Shah’ notorious secret police, SAVAK. Taken to prison, Valeh encounters a horrific brutal system of torture and dehumanisation. Concerned for the welfare of his wife and new-born child, Valeh finds himself being asked by his fellow Communist prisoners to take on a role as a martyr to the cause of liberation. But distraught for his family, fearful for his life and increasingly being driven insane by torture and solitary confinement, Valeh begins to reject the tenets of Marxism. Makhmalbaf was himself imprisoned under the Pahlavi regime, and Valeh’s intellectual trajectory from Marxism to Islamic radical spiritualism, mirrors the filmmakers own personal history as a working-class agitator who became a leading artist of the Iranian Revolution. Valeh’s spiritual transcendence is rendered obliquely, but unlike, for example, the spiritual cinema of Tarkovsky, spiritual concerns do not outweigh the importance of politics or of Valeh’s terror of his increasing madness. As the chilling final scene makes clear - in a stunningly executed balletic sequence which again recalls Gavras - the savagery of the Shah’s regime demands agitation and revolt. “Boycott” is a film that veers from moments of stark beauty to thriller melodramatics, but it is a crucial work in the development of a key contemporary director. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: Croupier
results.creator_credit: Mike Hodges, Jonathan Cavendish, Arte, WDR La Sept Cinema, Filmstiftung NRW and Channel Four Films
results.brief_description: Mike Hodges’ slow-burning “Croupier” is the tale of one man’s addiction to watching people lose; and whose detached observation of the sleaze and depression in the world of gambling becomes his only means of self-fulfillment. Jack Manfred (Clive Owen) is a former croupier and struggling writer lured back to casino work by his estranged father. Therein he encounters without any real surprise the business of letting people lose, and soon his relationships with those close to him take on a similar sense of self-interest and subtle cruelty. Interwoven with the robberies, intrigue and exoticism is a commentary on the alienation bred by gambling and the lifestyle it entails. Cast also includes Gina McKee, Kate Hardie and Paul Reynolds.

results.title: John Lee Hooker: that's my story
results.brief_description: This documentary traces the life and times of famous Afro-American blues musician John Lee Hooker. Born in the heart of the Mississippi Delta Hooker went on to become a famous, influential and highly respected player. Made for television this documentary features interviews with many of Hooker’s music peers, including Carlos Santana, Eric Clapton, Bonnie Rait, Edie Kirkland and Robert Cray. Various artists discuss the influence of Hooker on their music and the remarkable life and times of this great artist. Family and friends discuss the cultural influence of Hooker and the effect that he had on them personally. Features a current interview with Hooker as well as archival footage of him playing in the 1950s. Songs include Dimples, Maudie, I’m in the mood, Crawlin’ Kingsnake, This is hip and Boogie chillin. John Lee Hooker died in 2001, at the age of 83.
